title: Coffee Set, ca. 1902
markings: On underside: printed in green: "SCHULE PROF KOLO MOSER [in rectangle];" painted in red enamel on underside: "D501".
provenance: Purchase from the Charles E. Sampson Memorial Fund
dimensions:
Coffee pot and cover: H x W x D: 20 x 13.5 x 9 cm (7 7/8 x 5 5/16 x 3 9/16 in.)
Sugar bowl and cover: H x diam.: 11 x 10.5 cm (4 5/16 x 4 1/8 in.)
Jug: H x W x D: 8.5 x 10.5 x 8 cm (3 3/8 x 4 1/8 x 3 1/8 in.)
Cup: H x W x D: 6 x 11 x 8.7 cm (2 3/8 x 4 5/16 x 3 7/16 in.)
Saucer: H x diam.: 2.4 x 16.2 cm (15/16 x 6 3/8 in.)
Dessert plate: H x diam.: 2.1 x 18.5 cm (13/16 x 7 5/16 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase from Charles E. Sampson Memorial Fund
description: Tall slightly conical form with broad, flat triangular handle with circular opening; small curved triangular spout; white ground overall, the bottom decorated with various sized circles, some overlapping; white lid with large flat triangular handle with pierced circle at back. Part of a set that includes a covered sugar bowl, milk jug, cup and saucer, and plate.

tombstone.epitaph:
Coffee Set, ca. 1902.
ca. 1902. Porcelain, enamel. Museum purchase from Charles E. Sampson Memorial Fund. 1986-83-1/5.
